page.title: 17GT.HORKESLEY CHURCH
page.content: All Saints Church,Gt.Horkesley was built in the 12th century as a Chapel_of_Ease for the Nayland Church. A chancel,a vestry,the Lady Chapel and the tower was built in the 14th century.In the 15th century the North Aisle was built and the tower was added to. As the Church is at the northern end of the village,it is some distance from the main housing area and so St. John's Church was built at the end of the 19th century at the southern end of the village.Some Services are still held every Sunday at All Saints. The local school children visit the church to study its history and on one Sunday in July a special School Service is held.Although most people are cremated when they die the graveyard is still used for burials and there is a new area with recent graves.
